title: Cowan, Ernest
text:
Ernest Eugene "Ernie" Cowan, 93, a resident of Harrison, was called home to be with his Lord and Savior on Tuesday, May 21, 2024, at Countryside at Rock Springs in Harrison.
Ernie was born on September 6, 1930, in Harrison, to Mark Binkley and Cora Belle Young Cowan. He attended school at Grubb Springs and Harrison High. He served in the United States Army during the Korean War, stationed in Fairbanks, Alaska. Ernie met the love of his life, Dolly Gibson, and they were married on May 24, 1958, at Joplin, Missouri. They had two sons, Stacey and Tracy. Ernie worked for Rocketdyne, Lockheed and Alltel Telephone of Harrison where he retired. Ernie and Dolly traveled the US and spent 25 years as snowbirds in south Texas. While at home, he grew apples in his orchard of 400+ trees and always had a big garden. Ernie was a Sunday school teacher and active member at Grubb Springs Baptist Church. He enjoyed wood working, HAM radio, spending time with his family, and was a 32 Degree Mason. He was preceded in death by his parents and his siblings, Elizabeth Ruth, Arlis Lee, Carl Dee, Lonnie Dennis, Earl Joseph, Olin Price, Mark Binkley Jr., James Leroy, and Betty Frances.
Ernie is survived by his wife of 65, almost 66 years, Dolly Cowan of Harrison; two sons, Stacey Mark Cowan, and his wife, Vicky, of Ennis, Texas and Tracy Lee Cowan, and his wife, Pat, of Midland, Texas; his four grandchildren, LeTara (Eric) Sgroi, Stacey (Vanessa) Cowan, Brandon Cowan, and Kacey Cowan; four great-grandchildren, AdaLynn Cowan, Ryan Cowan, Oliver Sgroi and Owen Sgroi; and other relatives and friends.
The funeral will be held at 10 a.m. on Tuesday, May 28, 2024, at Grubb Springs Baptist Church, with Pastor Bill Beach officiating. Burial with military honors provided by the United States Army, will be in Grubb Springs Cemetery under the direction of Holt Memorial Chapel.
Pallbearers will be Brandon Cowan, Stacey Cowan, Joe Terry, Gene Moore, David Cowan, and Bo Phillips.
Visitation will be from 6 to 8 p.m. on Monday, May 27th, at the funeral home.
Memorials may be made to Grubb Springs Baptist Church, Post Office Box 86, Harrison, Arkansas 72602.
The online obituary and guestbook are available at www.HoltChapel.com.
